Dear Mr. Mitchell:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/18/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all
of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department
of human services, the equivalent state or
Canadian provincial agency, or equivalent
agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been
determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or
child neglect. The documentation shall be
completed not more than 30 days prior to the
start of employment and every 12 months
thereafter.
Four of eleven new employee files held a central registry clearance that was
completed more than 30 days prior to hire.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency was required to submit one corrective action plan during this period
under review. The CAP, approved 6/7/23, was the result of the 4/24/23 interim
review. The agency was cited regarding employee references, health and dental
screenings, placement preparation, restraint, seclusion, and late service plans.
The agency implemented their CAP and completed monthy CAP reviews with staff
to improve compliance. During the 2024 renewal evaluation it was determined the
agency demonstrated successful implementation of their CAP, as there were no
repeat violations found.
Financial Overview
The agency's 2024 budget was reviewed on-site. No concerns were found.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
The facility appears to be in compliance with PREA.

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site. The
Chief Administrator (CA) reported challenges with a staffing shortage. Plans were
implemented to dedicate a significant amount of time to recruitment, hiring. and
training of direct care staff. The agency has successfully hired several staff.
However, there are some vacant positions remaining.
The CA reported implementation of the CAP from the 2023 review has been
successful. Monthly CAP reviews are ongoing to ensure compliance. Overall, the
CA indicated confidence in improvement over each area of the 2023 CAP.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two direct care staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported enjoying their
jobs at the facility. Both staff stated they found their job fulfilling and enjoyed
mentoring youth. Neither staff reported any concerns or suggestions for
improvement.
Two youth were interviewed on-site. Both youth reported feeling safe and
supported by staff. Both youth had been at the facility for several months and
indicated they felt their needs were being met. Neither youth expressed any
concerns, nor identified areas for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through was completed of the milieu, kitchen, youth bedrooms, and
recreation area. Menus were posted throughout the facility and reviewed. The
facility was clean and well maintained.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
